org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.qjournal.client

Class QuorumCall<KEY,RESULT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.qjournal.client.QuorumCall<KEY,RESULT>
  • Type Parameters:
    KEY - a key used to identify each of the outgoing calls
    RESULT - the type of the call result

     class QuorumCall<KEY,RESULT>
extends Object
    Represents a set of calls for which a quorum of results is needed.

      • create

      • waitFor

        public void waitFor(int minResponses,
           int minSuccesses,
           int maxExceptions,
           int millis,
           String operationName)
             throws InterruptedException,
                    TimeoutException
        Wait for the quorum to achieve a certain number of responses. Note that, even after this returns, more responses may arrive, causing the return value of other methods in this class to change.
        Parameters:
        minResponses - return as soon as this many responses have been received, regardless of whether they are successes or exceptions
        minSuccesses - return as soon as this many successful (non-exception) responses have been received
        maxExceptions - return as soon as this many exception responses have been received. Pass 0 to return immediately if any exception is received.
        millis - the number of milliseconds to wait for
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting
        TimeoutException - if the specified timeout elapses before achieving the desired conditions

      • checkAssertionErrors

        private void checkAssertionErrors()
        Check if any of the responses came back with an AssertionError. If so, it re-throws it, even if there was a quorum of responses. This code only runs if assertions are enabled for this class, otherwise it should JIT itself away. This is done since AssertionError indicates programmer confusion rather than some kind of expected issue, and thus in the context of test cases we'd like to actually fail the test case instead of continuing through.

      • addResult

             RESULT res)

      • addException

        private void addException(KEY k,
                Throwable t)

      • countResponses

        public int countResponses()
        Returns:
        the total number of calls for which a response has been received, regardless of whether it threw an exception or returned a successful result.

      • countSuccesses

        public int countSuccesses()
        Returns:
        the number of calls for which a non-exception response has been received.

      • countExceptions

        public int countExceptions()
        Returns:
        the number of calls for which an exception response has been received.

      • getResults

        public Map<KEY,RESULT> getResults()
        Returns:
        the map of successful responses. A copy is made such that this map will not be further mutated, even if further results arrive for the quorum.

      • rethrowException

        public void rethrowException(String msg)
                      throws QuorumException
        Throws:
        QuorumException

        private String getExceptionMapString()
        Return a string suitable for displaying to the user, containing any exceptions that have been received so far.
